column3: a little girl called Phyllis was born into the world. Two people in love hugged their sweet little babe. No one knew
column5: what a dancer they'd made. By the time she was four
column6: she had learned very quick. She impressed all her teachers with her ducky feet flicks! Before school and after
column7: she danced every day. Nothing pleased Phyllis more than ballet. When the world was ready for Phyllis at fifteen
column10: ready to live her dream. She said goodbye to all her friends. She was ready to start fresh. Watch out
column11: Royal Ballet School! Phyllis is here to impress. When Phyllis danced Swan Lake
column12: it was fit to show the Queen! After years of pirouetting
column13: she was ready to be seen. Dancing for the audience
column14: she turned and twirled about. Look! Everyone is smiling! See how they clap and shout!
